### Post-Event Surveys for the Health and Air Quality Forecasting Program
####  Request for Proposal
### Announcement Details
#### Reference Number: cb-982-94251252
#### Amendment No.: 4
#### Solicitation No.: 5000076053
#### Publication Date: December 11, 2023
#### Tender Closing Date: Tuesday, January 10, 2024, 02:00 PM EST
#### Amendment Date: January 10, 2024
#### Expected Contract Start Date: January 29, 2024
#### Expected Contract End Date: March 31, 2025

#### Tender Status: Expiré (Expired)

#### Key Information
* **UNSPC Codes**:
    * 77121501: Air Quality Management
    * 80141510: Market Research Telephone Surveys
    * 81171901: Air Quality Science Services
* **Procurement Method**: Competitive - Traditional
* **Trade Agreements**: Canada-Peru Free Trade Agreement, Canada-Colombia Free Trade Agreement, Canada-Korea Free Trade Agreement, CGTA, Canada-Panama Free Trade Agreement
* **Region of Opportunity**: Canada
* **Region of Delivery**: National Capital Region (NCR)

#### Request Details
Environment and Climate Change Canada has a requirement to run post-event surveys for the Health and Air Quality Forecasting Program. The objective of this request for proposal is to solicit proposals from qualified suppliers able to meet the requirements outlined in the Statement of Work (Annex A) of the bid solicitation.

#### Proposal Requirements
* The proposed solution must address the requirements outlined in the Statement of Work (Annex A).
* Suppliers must demonstrate their ability to conduct post-event surveys, as detailed in the requirement.
* The solution must demonstrate highest technical merit within a stipulated maximum budget.

#### Qualification Process
Only proposals from qualified suppliers will be considered. Qualified suppliers will be those who have the technical expertise, experience and resources to meet the requirements outlined in this RFP.

#### How to Submit a Proposal
A copy of the RFP package is available for download from the Canada Buys website: https://canadabuys.canada.ca/. Suppliers must submit their proposals electronically via the Canada Buys website.

#### Contact Information
For any questions or concerns related to this RFP, please contact:

* Annie Emard, Environmental Protection Branch
* Email: annie.emard@ec.gc.ca
